channel.title: Inside story on the RROD
channel.description:
http://gizmodo.com/5046314/the-shocking-inside-story-of-the-epic-defects-that-killed-millions-of-xbox-360s
good read. turns out MS knew about the defects of the console long before launch but cut back on their budget $2m.
The consoles weren't tested properly...same old MS

item.title: Inside story on the RROD
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

only 16 out of every 100 of its IBM-made processors worked—to production lines, where just before launch, an unbelievable 68 percent of consoles made were clunkers.

lol’d, i guess mine was one of them.

Read full topic

item.title: Inside story on the RROD
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Gizmodo

The Shocking Inside Story of the Epic Defects That Killed Millions of Xbox 360s

Dean Takahashi, one of the most respected tech journos around, spent years putting together this mind-blowing expose that reveals the truly epic scale of the problems that lead to millions of dead Xbox 360s. It really is one of the most stunning...

good read. turns out MS knew about the defects of the console long before launch but cut back on their budget $2m.

The consoles weren’t tested properly…same old MS
